Yes, many other job board platforms also offer employer branding tools to help employers attract more job seekers and build their brand. Here are a few examples:

1. Glassdoor: Glassdoor provides a range of employer branding tools, including the ability for employers to create a company profile, share information about their culture and values, and respond to employee reviews.
2. LinkedIn: LinkedIn offers a range of employer branding tools, including company pages, the ability to post updates and share information about your company, and the ability to showcase your employees and company culture.
3. Monster: Monster provides a range of employer branding tools, including company profiles, the ability to showcase your company culture and values, and custom job postings that match your brand.
4. Indeed: Indeed offers a range of employer branding tools, including custom job postings, company profiles, and the ability to showcase your company culture and values.

These are just a few examples of the many job board platforms that offer employer branding tools. The exact features and resources available will vary from platform to platform, but in general, these tools are designed to help employers build a stronger and more recognizable brand, and attract more high-quality job seekers to their job listings.
